result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher A. Jones

records.addlTxt: Form CR 270, Crim Complaint & Dr Report sent to DHS, WCS notified and copy of order to KCJ
Order for Exam (NGI Form Cr -270)
Proposed Order for Exam (NGI Form CR 270)

11:52 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christopher A. Jones in court, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Caley in court for Christopher A. Jones. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Caley advises the Court that the DE is changing his plea today. DE enters a NG plea by mental disease or defect. Court ordered exam for mental disease or defect. Court will scheduled matter for a status hearing.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Christopher A. Jones appeared with Attorney Zachary Caley.  Defendant in custody.  Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Ofc Luke Hofmann; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Caley. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.   Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling Order

State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Caley.  Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Caley states they are not contesting the Dr. report. DE states he is competent. Court finds the DE competent to proceed. PH set to 09/08/22 at 8:15.

Minutes:  10:10am.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Daniel Tombasco appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody along w/Atty Zachary Caley.  VRC.  Wisc. Forensic Unit has requested an extension to complete the report.  CH set over to 8/26/22 @ 11am.  Previous defense counsel filed a bond motion.  Arguments heard.  State objects to lifting the no contact order with PLG & AL.  Deft's bond motion is denied for the reasons set forth on the record.
Atty Zachary Caley
Competency Evaluation Extension Letter
CR 205, Crim complaint sent to DHS, WCS notified, copy to KCJ
Form CR 205
Proposed Order for Competency Exam

Defendant, Christopher A. Jones, appeared with Attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Attorney Michael David Graveley appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Bub raises issue of competency in DE.  Court orders competency exam.   Bond continued.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

117PM - 121PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Christopher Bub. Victims not present.  Clerk PU Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:30 am..   Bond  continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry). DE Motion to Modify Bond will be reserved until next hearing. rb
from P.L.G.   with Comm response to distribute copy to all parties.
from the court re: Judicial Rotation on 8/1/22
To Modify Bond

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Christopher Bub

Defendant Christopher A. Jones in court, in custody.  Intern Sydney Star with  Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
DE is eligible for SPD services, however, no atty has agreed to represent this applicant.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Paula L. - G. and Andrew L.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

02:22 PM  
  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Francesco Balistrieri.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on 5/17/22 @ 945am.  PO Hold.  $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).   jk
